title: Designing for Security
abstract: Good security requires basic usability. This universal truth can be demonstrated with a handful of examples, ranging from the UX of key handling, mental models of password managers, and visual styling against phishing. Going deeper, we will ask: why are these tools suffering from a lack of usability, and what can we do about it? Expect a love-hate letter to open source, and a basic introduction to human-centered design methods to incorporate in your development process. ...
